relative adverb.description: (with reference to a reason) on account of which; for which.
examples: the reason why flu shots need repeating every year is that the virus changes

exclamation.description: Used to add emphasis to a response.

examples: the whys and wherefores of these procedures need to be explained to students

phrases: We get bits and pieces of meaning, some glimpses of hope and we ponder again and again, why so?
origin: Old English hwī, hwȳ by what cause, instrumental case of hwæt what, of Germanic origin.
